page.title: 13TAX INSPECTOR INTERVIEW
page.content: I asked the inspector if he thought that more people were paying tax now than in previous years. He thought not because more people are unemployed. He also said the Budgets had taken lower paid people out of Tax Liability. I then asked him if he thought unemployed people should pay tax on their dole. He answered that he thought that unemployment was a problem that had arisen through high interest rates, therefore the unemployed should not pay tax on their dole. He told me that the higher crime rate was the result of many unemployed people stealing goods but that young hooligans only shoplifted and mugged for want of a better thing to do. He said he didn't know if the Government should try to create more jobs.
